availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, music teacher. Berlin, Prussia native. Married to Katharine Smith Albert on August 6, 1856. Father of Anna Francesca Albert, Mary Albert, Florance Albert, and Sophia Albert. Music teacher in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 9, p. 965A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 50.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 5, p. 22.
Kentucky Marriage Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Mason County Marriages, p. 11.
George Norbury Mackenzie and Nelson Osgood Rhoades, eds., Colonial Families of the United States of America, Vol. IV (1912, Reprinted, Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co., Inc., 1966), 229.
